titles: The life of Dom John de Castro, the fourth vice-roy of India wherein are seen the Portuguese's voyages to the East-Indies, their discoveries and conquests there, the form of government, commerce, and discipline of warr in the east, and the topography of all India and China : containing also a particular relation of the most famous siege of Dio, with a map to illustrate it / by Jacinto Freire de Andrada, written in Portuguese ; and by Sr Peter Wyche, Kt., translated into English.
Vida de Dom João de Castro, quarto viso-rey da India. English
author: Freire de Andrade, Jacinto, 1597-1657.
Wyche, Peter, Sir, 1628-1699?
publisher: Printed for Henry Herringman, and are to be sold at his shop ...,
notes: Translation of: Vida de Dom João de Castro, quarto viso-rey da India.
Reproduction of original in Harvard University Libraries.
keywords: Viceroys --  India --  Goa, Daman and Diu.
